pgTitle: List of ISAF installations in Afghanistan

rows.text: The largest American base in Afghanistan.
This camp is within Bagram Airfield and houses the contractors altogether.
Operated as part of FOB Salerno in Khowst Province. Named after Green Beret Matt Pucino.
First US land base established in Afghanistan
Before 2011 it was called Combat Post Arian.
May be confused with FOB Todd.
Named for SGT Jay Blessing (2nd Battalion, 75th Ranger Regiment) who was killed by an IED.
Renamed after Captain Dave Boris of Anvil Troop, 1st Squadron 91st Cavalry, 173rd Airborne Brigade in 2007 and was previously called FOB Bermel.
Near Kamu. Renamed Bostick from Naray in 2008 after Maj. Thomas Bostick, former commander of Bravo Troop, 1st Squadron, 91st Cavalry Regiment (Airborne).
Located miles (km) north east of Khost.
Named after Private Robert Costall, Canada's first combat casualty in the War on Terror.
Formerly used by the United Kingdom.
Last remaining US outpost in Nuristan Province. Outpost near to Battle of Do Ab
Active as of August 2011. May be called FOB Khar Nikah.
U.S Army Canadian Forces Afghan National Army (ANA)
3rd Stryker Brigade Combat Team, 2nd Infantry Division (Task Force Arrowhead) Base of operations for Canada's C2 Leopard 1 and Leopard 2A6M tanks.
(101st Airborne, 10th Mountain, 82nd Airborne, 2nd BCT) also called FOB Wilson
(USMC platoon attached there in 2008 2/7 Echo Co) Now MOB Price
United States United Kingdom Denmark United Arab Emirates Canada Afghanistan
U.S Army British Army Danish Defence Union Defence Force Canadian Forces Afghan National Army
Named after Staff Sergeant Christopher L. Robinson, 36, Brandon, Mississippi. Active as of March 2009.
Last occupants:2nd Battalion the Duke of Lancaster’s Regiment.
Former home to Provincial Reconstruction Team Zabul
Canadian Forces U.S Army Afghan Police
Named for Staff Sgt. Paul Sweeney
Next to Camp Shorabak (ANA) and Camp Bastion. Active as of October 2011
D Company, 1st Battalion The Royal Gurkha Rifles (1RGR)
(101st Airborne, 10th Mountain, 82nd Airborne, 2nd BCT) also called FOB Pasab
Formerly USMC 2008, 2/7 Echo CO. Active as of April 2010.
Active as of April 2012. Formerly used by the British Army.
Royal Air Force United States Air Force
Formerly FOB Price. Active as of July 2013.
Unknown relation to PB Almas. Active as of April 2013.
Most recent unit was:4th Battalion The Rifles
Handed over to the Afghan security forces.
Last unit:1st Battalion The Duke of Lancaster’s Regimen
Formerly FOB Sandford. Active as of March 2012.
Was once home to B Company, the 1st Battalion The Royal Welsh
Handed over to Afghan security forces. Last UK unit was 1st Battalion The Royal Anglian Regiment.
B Company, 1st Battalion The Royal Gurkha Rifles (1RGR)
